cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi E of Tampico, Mexico and 330 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly north-northeast, expected to turn north and then west toward the central-upper Texas coast through the next 4-5 days
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (roughly between Corpus Christi and Galveston, TX)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches in effect Thursday night – interests along the western Gulf coast advised to monitor
weather_observation.impacted_coast: western and north-western Gulf of Mexico, especially the Texas shoreline and adjacent Mexican coast
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤4%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds reaching the port late Monday–Tuesday; most guidance keeps winds well below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the Port of New Orleans given the forecast track well to the west.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of showers possible early next week, but widespread flooding rains at the port are unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along Gulf beaches may extend eastward into Louisiana early next week, but direct operational impacts at the port are minimal at this time.
